intro: Rhopalocarpus similis subsp. velutinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf rhopalocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The species is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
